qas.question: What band did Kanye tour with for a year?
What setting did Kanye want his next tracks to perform well in?
Who did Kanye study in order to develop his lyrical skills?
Which band did Kanye West travel with for the Vertigo Tour?
What decade of music inspired Kanye West after his tour with U2?
Other than U2 and Led Zeppelin, what other band inspired Kanye West?
What other country singer besides Johnny Cash did Kanye listen to?

context: Fresh off spending the previous year touring the world with <a0_0><a3_0>U2<a3_0/><a0_0/> on their Vertigo Tour, West felt inspired to compose anthemic rap songs that could operate more efficiently in <a1_0>large arenas<a1_0/>. To this end, West incorporated the synthesizer into his hip-hop production, utilized slower tempos, and experimented with electronic music and influenced by music of the <a4_0>1980s<a4_0/>. In addition to U2, West drew musical inspiration from arena rock bands such as <a5_0>The Rolling Stones<a5_0/> and Led Zeppelin in terms of melody and chord progression. To make his next effort, the third in a planned tetralogy of education-themed studio albums, more introspective and personal in lyricism, West listened to folk and country singer-songwriters <a2_0><a6_0>Bob Dylan<a6_0/> and Johnny Cash<a2_0/> in hopes of developing methods to augment his wordplay and storytelling ability.
